Standard pathway list

Standard pathway list

Promote links to standard content within the context of a page.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Standard pathway

The standard pathway is an in-page link to another page on the site.

Variations

The default heading is H3 but it can also be H4. Refer to the typography guidelines.

CSS styles

Desktop

Title
h3 {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Description
p.description {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
    letter-spacing: 0.2px;
}
Icon link
.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
.icon:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 32px;
    width: 32px;
}
Container
.container {
    background: #FFFFFF;
    padding: 24px;
    border-top: 4px solid #254F90;
    box-shadow: 0 0.125rem 0.75rem 0
    rgba(0,0,0,.2);
}

Mobile

Heading
h3 {    
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    line-height: 30px;
    letter-spacing: 0;
}

Guidelines for use

Purpose

Generally used as a default option within index pages or to build page hierarchy as a secondary weight against hero and light pathways.

When to use this component

Coming soon.

Layouts

Page width

Standard pathway components should only be used in full width pages.

Equal width layout

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.

Examples and assets

View design and assets in Adobe XD.
